revisions.rev:
{{Infobox person | name = Caroline Bliss | image = Miss Moneypenny by Caroline Bliss.jpg | caption = Caroline Bliss as Miss Moneypenny in The Living Daylights. | birth_date = July 1961 | birth_place = [[England]] | height = 5'6" (1.68m) | death_date = | birth_name = Caroline Bliss | othername = Caroline Seacombe | homepage = | notable role = ''[[Miss Moneypenny]]'' in ''[[The Living Daylights]]'' and ''[[Licence to Kill]]'' }} '''Caroline Bliss''' (born 1961) is an [[England|English]] actress who trained at the [[Bristol Old Vic Theatre School]] and a granddaughter of composer [[Sir Arthur Bliss]]. She is best known for her appearance as [[M (James Bond)|M's]] secretary, [[Miss Moneypenny]], in the [[James Bond]] films of the [[Timothy Dalton]] era. At the age of 26, she replaced the long-standing [[Lois Maxwell]] in the film ''[[The Living Daylights]]'' and ''[[Licence to Kill]]''. She was succeeded by [[Samantha Bond]], who would play the role in [[1995 in film|1995's]] ''[[GoldenEye]]'' alongside [[Pierce Brosnan]]. ==James Bond franchise== Caroline Bliss was featured in two James Bond movies although her role in ''Licence to Kill'' was reduced to little more than a [[cameo role|cameo]]. Bliss is also the youngest actress to have played Moneypenny. *''[[The Living Daylights]]'' ([[1987 in film|1987]]) *''[[Licence to Kill]]'' ([[1989 in film|1989]]) ==Filmography== Her film and television work includes appearances in: * ''[[Charles & Diana: A Royal Love Story]]'' (1982) (TV)... [[princess diana]] * ''[[Killer Contract]]'' (1984)... (TV) Celia Routledge * ''[[Pope John Paul II: The Movie]]'' (1984) (TV)... Rosa Kossack * ''[[My Brother Jonathan]]'' (1985) (TV)... Edie Martyn *''The Moneymen'' (1987) (TV)... Sarah * ''[[The Living Daylights]]'' (1987)... [[Miss Moneypenny]] * ''[[Licence to Kill]]'' (1989)... [[Miss Moneypenny]] * ''[[Braxton (film)|Braxton]]'' (1989)... Vanessa Rawlings * ''[[The Paradise Club]]'' (1990) (TV)... DI Sarah turnbull * ''[[Insektors]]'' (1994) (TV) * ''[[The Ruth Rendell Mysteries|Ruth Rendell - A Case of Coincidence]]'' (1996) (TV)... Sarah quin * ''[[Blitzlicht]]'' (aka ''Inside Out'' in the U.S.) (1996) ==Theatre== Her theatre work includes: *''Blood Brothers'' *''Blue Remembered Hills'' *''Eve'' *''Fuente Ovejuna'' *''Good'' *''Particular Friendships'' *''Romeo and Juliet'' *''Rough Justice'' *''The Invisible Man'' *''The Night They Raided Minskys'' ==External links== *{{imdb name|id=0088504|name=Caroline Bliss}} *[http://www.telegraph.co.uk/portal/main.jhtml?xml=/portal/2008/01/05/wkfront050108.xml An actor's search for the simple life] {{sequence| prev=[[Lois Maxwell]]
